sub_fields.label: Post Type
sub_fields.name: post_type
sub_fields.instructions: Select the post type of the posts to render. This represents the initial pool of posts available to display.

sub_fields.label: Pre-Filters
sub_fields.name: pre_filters
sub_fields.instructions: Only the posts matching all the pre-filters will be available.

sub_fields.label: Anchor
sub_fields.name: anchor
sub_fields.instructions: Specifies the date that will be used as point of reference, from which the start and end dates will be relative to.

sub_fields.label: Unit
sub_fields.name: unit
sub_fields.instructions: Indicates the time unit to be used to calculate the start and end of the date range.

sub_fields.label: Start
sub_fields.name: start
sub_fields.instructions: The start of the range will be this many time units from the anchor date.

sub_fields.label: End
sub_fields.name: end
sub_fields.instructions: The end of the range will be this many time units from the anchor date.

sub_fields.label: Use Hash
sub_fields.name: use_hash
sub_fields.instructions: Set to Yes to read and update the URL hash to represent the selected controls, search and page (Default: No)

sub_fields.label: Show Open/Close
sub_fields.name: show_open_close
sub_fields.instructions: Set to Yes to render buttons to open and close the controls (Default: No)

sub_fields.label: Show Search
sub_fields.name: show_search
sub_fields.instructions: Select whether to show the search bar or not (Default: Yes)

sub_fields.label: Show Clear
sub_fields.name: show_clear
sub_fields.instructions: Select whether to show the clear button used to reset all controls, search and page (Default: Yes)

sub_fields.label: Layout
sub_fields.name: layout
sub_fields.instructions: Select the layout of the controls: Stacked or Tabbed (Default: Stacked)

sub_fields.label: Show Controls On No Results
sub_fields.name: show_controls_on_no_results
sub_fields.instructions: Select whether controls should be shown when there are no results. (Default: No)

sub_fields.label: Open Label
sub_fields.name: open_label
sub_fields.instructions: Enter the text to be shown on the open button. (Default: Filters)

sub_fields.label: Close Label
sub_fields.name: close_label
sub_fields.instructions: Enter the text to be shown on the close button. (Default: Close)

sub_fields.label: Search Placeholder
sub_fields.name: search_placeholder
sub_fields.instructions: Enter the text to be shown as placeholder on the search bar. (Default: Search by Keyword)

sub_fields.label: Clear Label
sub_fields.name: clear_label
sub_fields.instructions: Enter the text to be shown on the clear button. (Default: Clear)

sub_fields.label: Visible
sub_fields.name: visible
sub_fields.instructions: Set to No to hide the filter from the user interface. The filtering functionality will be available programmatically. (Default: Yes)

sub_fields.label: Alias
sub_fields.name: alias
sub_fields.instructions: Optional. A user-friendly alias to be used in the hash instead of the default control name (e.g. taxonomy name or field name)

sub_fields.label: Presentation
sub_fields.name: presentation
sub_fields.instructions: Select the way in which the field will be presented in the user interface. (Default: Select)

sub_fields.label: Custom Label
sub_fields.name: label
sub_fields.instructions: Enter a custom label to override the default label from the selected taxonomy or field.

sub_fields.label: Options Order By
sub_fields.name: order_by
sub_fields.instructions: Select the way in which the filter options will be sorted. (Default: Alphabetical)

sub_fields.label: Options Order
sub_fields.name: order
sub_fields.instructions: Select the way in which the filter options will be ordered. (Default: Ascending)

sub_fields.label: Custom Options Order
sub_fields.name: custom_order
sub_fields.instructions: Enter the filter values in the order you would like them to be sorted.

sub_fields.label: Narrow Options
sub_fields.name: narrow_options
sub_fields.instructions: Select whether or not this controller's options will be narrowed to only show options that will return valid items with the current filter selection. (Default: Yes)

sub_fields.label: Show View All
sub_fields.name: show_view_all
sub_fields.instructions: Select whether or not this filter's options will include a View All option that clears this control selection. (Default: Yes)

sub_fields.label: View All Label
sub_fields.name: view_all_label
sub_fields.instructions: Enter the label to be displayed for the View All option. (Default: View All)

sub_fields.label: Posts Render Mode
sub_fields.name: render_mode
sub_fields.instructions: Select the method that will be used for rendering. With PHP the filters and posts will be rendered server-side, taking advantage of the Cards block functionality. With JS the data is handled by JavaScript client-side. (Default: PHP)

sub_fields.label: Video Type
sub_fields.name: video_type
sub_fields.instructions: Select the type of source for the video. (Default: URL)

sub_fields.label: Link Style
sub_fields.name: link_style
sub_fields.instructions: Select the style for the card link. (Default: Button)

sub_fields.label: Use Post URL
sub_fields.name: use_post_url
sub_fields.instructions: Use the post URL as the main URL. (Default: Yes)

sub_fields.label: Link
sub_fields.name: link
sub_fields.instructions: Select the field to be used for the card URL.

sub_fields.label: Label Type
sub_fields.name: label_type
sub_fields.instructions: Select the source of the post labels: taxonomy or field. (Default: Taxonomy)

sub_fields.label: Post Content
sub_fields.name: post_content
sub_fields.instructions: Set to Yes to include the post content in the post data returned by the API. (Default: No)

sub_fields.label: Post Excerpt
sub_fields.name: post_excerpt
sub_fields.instructions: Set to Yes to include the post excerpt in the post data returned by the API. (Default: No)

sub_fields.label: Post Taxonomies
sub_fields.name: post_taxonomies
sub_fields.instructions: Select the taxonomies to be included in the post data returned by the API.

sub_fields.label: Post Fields
sub_fields.name: post_fields
sub_fields.instructions: Select the fields to be included in the post data returned by the API.

sub_fields.label: Post Author
sub_fields.name: post_author
sub_fields.instructions: Select the fields to be included in the author on the post data returned by the API. Be mindful that this information will be visible on the frontend and you may want to avoid showing certain fields like ID, login, or email. (Default: name, avatar)

sub_fields.label: Post Thumbnail
sub_fields.name: post_thumbnail
sub_fields.instructions: Set to Yes to include the post thumbnail URL in the post data returned by the API. (Default: No)

sub_fields.label: Thumbnail Sizes
sub_fields.name: thumbnail_sizes
sub_fields.instructions: Select the thumbnail sizes to be included in the post data returned by the API. (Default: Large)

sub_fields.label: Link Style
sub_fields.name: link_style
sub_fields.instructions: Select the style for the card link. (Default: Button)

sub_fields.label: Show All
sub_fields.name: show_all
sub_fields.instructions: Set to Yes to render all available posts at once and disable pagination. (Default: No)

sub_fields.label: Pagination
sub_fields.name: pagination
sub_fields.instructions: Displays buttons for navigating to next, previous, first and last pages. (Default: Yes)

sub_fields.label: Page Numbers
sub_fields.name: page_numbers
sub_fields.instructions: Select the number page number links to display. Ellipses are displayed as applicable except when selecting to show all. (Default: 3)

sub_fields.label: Pagination Details
sub_fields.name: pagination_details
sub_fields.instructions: Displays a counter of number of items and pages. (Default: Yes)

sub_fields.label: Show Posts per Page
sub_fields.name: show_posts_per_page
sub_fields.instructions: Set to Yes to show a field to select the number of posts per page. (Default: No)

sub_fields.label: Posts per Page
sub_fields.name: posts_per_page
sub_fields.instructions: The number of posts that will be rendered on each load. (Default: 10)

sub_fields.label: Posts per Page Options
sub_fields.name: posts_per_page_options
sub_fields.instructions: Enter a comma-separated list of options for number of posts per page. Add a * after an option to designate it as the default. (Default: 5,10*,20,50,100)

sub_fields.label: Posts Order
sub_fields.name: posts_order
sub_fields.instructions: By default posts are ordered by created date in descending order.

sub_fields.label: Data Type
sub_fields.name: data_type
sub_fields.instructions: By default field values are strings and are sorted as such. This is fine for string data but can result in unexpected ordering for numeric data. Choose the appropriate data type if you want to cast the values as a specific type.

sub_fields.label: Show No Results Message
sub_fields.name: show_no_results_message
sub_fields.instructions: Select whether a message should be displayed when the queries and filters result in no posts. (Default: Yes)

sub_fields.label: No Results Message
sub_fields.name: no_results_message
sub_fields.instructions: Enter the message that will be displayed when no posts results from the filters and queries.
